title.narrative: Strategic Partnership Lobbying en Advocacy Programme International

description.narrative: International

Outcome 1: Human Rights are effectively enforced and aligned with international norms by governments, ILO and UN (Protect and Remedy) Outcome 2: Civil Society Organisations (trade unions and NGOs) have become more effective actors and have strengthened their role in Human Rights Protection and Remedy actions in the RMG sector. (Protect, Respect and Remedy). More specifically, Trade unions and NGOs will be more effective participants in human rights protection through increased capacity for lobby and advocacy. Outcome 3: Actions of companies (brands and factories) in the RMG sector actively and effectively support and implement Human Rights at the company level. (Respect and Remedy)
Payment of living wages Social dialogue as standard industry behaviour Elimination of gender-based violence and discrimination at work

title.narrative: Inclusive labour rights

description.narrative: Inclusive Labour rights, laws and policies are respected, promoted and adquately practiced.

title.narrative: # of public or private sector institutions that implement (inter)national standards and policies to improve labour conditions

description.narrative: # of new/updated/ improved labour policies and laws on SP issues are adequately practised upon

comment.narrative: Q2: In June 2019, the Dutch Agreement on Sustainable Garments and Textile (AGT) published the first decisions of its complaint mechanism concerning two member companies that did not comply with the agreements. One company cancelled its membership, the other agreed to comply to rules it had previously opposed. CNV has advocated for this complaint mechanism and engaged in the discussion around how to follow up the committees decision. Q3 (0): no results achieved in Q3.

title.narrative: # of (inter)national policies on SP issues implemented in accordance with standards or requirements

description.narrative: # of new/updated/ improved labour policies and laws on SP issues are adequately practised upon

comment.narrative: Q4: 1) Repport on SDG's and International Responsible Business Conduct published by the Social Economic Council 2) Report presented in Parliament

title.narrative: # of mechanisms or processes put in place by the public or private sector institutions to ensure implementation of new or updated policies on SP issues

description.narrative: # of new/updated/ improved labour policies and laws on SP issues are adequately practised upon

title.narrative: # of mechanisms or processes put in place by the public or private sector institutions to ensure implementation of new or updated policies on SP issues

description.narrative: # of new/updated/ improved labour policies and laws on SP issues are adequately practised upon

comment.narrative: Q2: The steering committee of the AGT decided in June 2019 from July 2019 onwards to publish the production sites of the members of the AGT on the Open Apparel Registry. This enhances the transparency of the initiative as the quality of the data is better, it is easier to compare and download. Also, 6 members have published their own production sites and another 3 have committed to do so soon. CNV has advocated in favour of this change in the steering committee. Q3 (0): no results achieved in Q3.

title.narrative: # of improved or new policies on SP issues, claims and policy goals (at regional, national or subnational level)

description.narrative: # of policies and laws on SP issues adopted/ blocked/ maintained that protect, respect or promote labour rights and improve labour conditions in the garments supply chain

comment.narrative: Q1 (0): no results achieved Q2 (0): No results achieved Q3 (1): EU with a new Commission and Parlament in place is drafting a new policy framework on due diligence, CSR as well as a circular garment industry approach. Q4: 1) EU Vietnam Free Trade Agreement being discussed in the European Parliament 2) EU Vietnam Free Trade agreement discussed at/with Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Breed Handelsberaad) 3) EBA and situation in Cambodia discussed with MoFA with Cambodian partner

Q1. in the proces of writing a SD document for dutch embassies, how SD can be encouraged by embassies.
Q3 embassies received the SD paper and responded positively. "- Embassy SD paper developed and shared - Input Nota Kaag - Input vraag Begrotingsbehandeling "
Q4: 1) Brown report adjusted after consultation with Ministry of Social Affairs, based upon the input of CNV Interntaionaal and FNV 2) Attention for textilesector, living wage and CSR in Parliament in 2 debates 1) CSR 2) Budget 2019

title.narrative: # of policies or laws formally adopted or blocked in favour of SP claims or issues

description.narrative: # of policies and laws on SP issues adopted/ blocked/ maintained that protect, respect or promote labour rights and improve labour conditions in the garments supply chain

comment.narrative: Q2 (2): 1) The Child Labour Due Diligence Act was adopted in Senate, which requires companies to determine wether child labour exists in their supply chains: 1) AD had a meeting wiht MVO Platform about how to get the improved law through Senate 2) AD sent input to Senator Petra Stienen (D66) about the key position of D66 to get this law through; 2) ILO (International Labour Organization) adopted a new Convention on violence and harassment in the world of work. It’s a major step towards giving workers across the world the right to a workplace free of violence and intimidation. Dutch trade unions FNV and CNV and Fair Wear Foundation have been lobbying and campaigning for years for an internationally binding treaty. Violence and harassment in the workplace is a persistent problem for many workers worldwide. Women in particular often have to deal with forms of violence and harassment in the workplace. The ILO Convention to end violence and harassment in the world of work was adopted at the ILO during the ILC June 2019. This convention is a victory for the international trade union movement. Q3 (1): The EU-Vietnam trade agreement was signed on July 1st

title.narrative: Increased capacities

description.narrative: Increased capacity to influence (L&A) on SP issues, claims and policy goals

title.narrative: # of advocates participating in capacity building (leadership development, trainings, etc) on SP policy-issues, claims or strategies

description.narrative: # of advocacy and policy champions promoting evidence base and influencing targeted policy and decision-makers

comment.narrative: 1. Presenting SD booklet at FoA DWWG, 2. presenting VAW booklet at RVO (see also indicator 4)

Q2 (1): In May 2019, CNV gave a presentation at the Nijenrode MBA to 30+ young business leaders about Social Dialogue and the role of trade unions in multistakeholder dialogues, in particular the AGT. On the same day, both a representative of the Brands as well as of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs underlined the importance of SD and the role of unions in making supply chains more sustainable. Q3 (0): no results achieved in Q3. Q4: 12 Dutch textile brands participate in roundtable on Freedom of Association, gaining general knowledge of topic, hands-on advice on how they can better promote this in their own supply chain, and context-specitic information on the trade union and worker situation in Bangladesh, Cambodia, India, Indonesia, Myanmar and Vietnam.
Q3: "- Living Wage Incubator - Textil Buendniss Living Wage expert group"

title.narrative: # of advocates (academics, brands, etc) promoting and influencing public awareness and political will on SP policy issues, claims or strategies

description.narrative: # of advocacy and policy champions promoting evidence base and influencing targeted policy and decision-makers

comment.narrative: Q2 (11): CNV has published press releases (Vietnam (2), Manifest in Parliament (1), ILO Convention/ILC (2) as well as an opinion article about the ILO Convention (1), also making use of twitter and FB to promote issues around SD and GBV (5). Q3 (1): Article publishe on the Fashion Pact

Q3: - Berlin Fashion Week: Promote FWF way of working: Responsible purchasing practices (using evidence of Avance report)
Q4: MODINT asked CNV (and also FNV, FWF and several other NGOs) to develop a DD tool for their members. The tool was published in November. MODINT also organised speed date sessions between their members and the organisations that developed the tool. CNV specifically gave input on FoA/SD and also shared our tool on GBV

comment.narrative: 1) Strengthened cooperation with WO=MEN in GBV lobby
1.FoA DWWG (see also indicator 4) 2. joining the CSR Asia Summit to see if we can present our SP work there in a later stage. 3. Garteks is part of CCC International, Regional and National Coalition

Q1 (2): 1) CNV Internationaal started developing a network with NGO's such as COC for support of the ILO Convention on ending violence and intimidation in the world of work; 2) CNV I was part of the Dutch UN delegation of Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Ministry of Education
Q2 (7): Our manifest about the ILO Convention received support of 7 ngo's (Rainforest Alliance, Plan NL, WO=MEN, Terre des Hommes, Hivos, ActionAid, Defence for Children) Q3 (1): During the platform meeting of MoFA about Trade Issues the EBA and GSP plus issues were discussed which are important issues to take into account for countries like Bangladesh, Myanmar and Cambodia Q4: Brainstorm with I&W, BZ, FWF, FNV about ideas for raising consumer awareness and/or sharing information through labels or other instruments

comment.narrative: Meeting with WO=MEN to support them in writing a paper on GBV

Q2 (1): In Vietnam we worked closely together with InRetail for the event about the IRBC and SDG's
Q3 (2): Two meetings/calls with ILO Better Work regarding the work in general and as a whole Q4: Meeting with ILO (Hanoi), Friedrich Ebert stiftung (Fes), Consul General (Ho Chi Minh City)

title.narrative: # of joint statements issues / collaborative advocacy efforts by partners and keys takeholders

description.narrative: # of advocacy initiatives carried out by partners and key stakeholders for, by or with their membership/constituency

comment.narrative:
Q1. Active role in CvD and Board of FWF. Extra Q1: In the proces of writing a SD document for dutch embassies, how SD can be encouraged by embassies. On ILO standard V@W. succesful lobby on Dutch position. Government was initially not in favour but changes its position after a meeting with CNV/FNV in March 2018 On ILO standard lobby on Dutch position. Government changes (again positively) its position after a meeting with CNV/FNV in May 2018.
Q3 Active role in CvD and Board of FWF and in Covenant social working group. Joint statement on Bangladesh.
Q4: Influenced the brown report consultation

Q2 (8): In April the SP (FWF, CNV and FNV) organized a work trip to Vietnam. CNV organized several parts of the program, such as a company visit, a visit to the trade union, a social dialogue seminar and the event on IRBC & SDG's together with the NL Embassy, and last but not least, together with MoFA, FWF, FNV we have organized the sustainable fashion show where prime minister Rutte was present as well the Vietnamese prime minister and minister of Labour. Also Willem Jelle Berg (CNV Board Member) held a speech during the fashio show. During the visit and talks we talked about social dialogue and also about GBV issues. In May 2019, AGT members sourcing from Cambodia co-signed a letter urging the Cambodian government to respect human, labour and trade union rights in order to prevent that the EBA will be suspended by the EU, which would have grave consequences for the garment industry. CNV acted as contact person for brands and provided information to the AGT secretariat on the situation and positioning, in cooperation with its trade union partner in Cambodia. In June, we handed over our manifest about the ILO Convention to 7 MP's. Q3 (3): Joint statement of FWF and CNV on the new labouw law in Vietnam. Analysis on the new Labour Code was drafted by CNV and shared with VGCL Informing Members of Parliament abour our work together with InRetail and Schijvens Q4: During Social Dialogue trip to Vietnam: joint statement about Social Dialogue of CNV and FWF Board Member Femke den Hartog as well as drafted together speaking points for Dutch ambassador in Vietnam on Social dialogue and the global garment supply chain

title.narrative: # of partnering stakeholders / organisations / platforms delivering services or capacitating with SP to promote or strengthen evidence-base, issues, claims or policy goals

description.narrative: # of partnering stakeholders included by alliance

comment.narrative:
Q1 (6): During the lobby week in Bangkok, where all partners of FWF, CNV and FNV came together and shared and exhanged knowlegde and best practices the issues of 1) living wage, 2) social dialogue and 3) GBV were extesively discussed as well as the way forward for 4) lobby and advocacy strategies; 5) Information on the situation in Cambodia has been shared with the Ministry of Foreing Affairs, based upon evidence-based information of CLC
Q2 (1): Meeting with Dan Rees of ILO Better Work (Geneva)
Q3 (1): Exchange of views with InRetail, as a follow up of the article about the Fashion Pact, to include human rights in a Dutch Fashion Pact

Supported and connected WE Fashion and CLC - joint visit to WE Fashion factory Cambodia. Decided on doing this on a more structural basis starting from 2018 onwards. And discussion / interview with C&A about SD/FoA in supply chains (related to their work in CAM)

comment.narrative: 1. GBV Forum in Vietnam 2. 18 May Conference 3. Active role in FoA Decent Work Working Group (DWWG) of Covenant 4. Meeting held with ACT (Berlin) with CNV & FWF to address LW and use the SP evidence in order to convince the sector 5.VAW session at RVO,

Q1 (1): Hanneke Smits was consulted by MODINT on social dialogue; during the stakeholders meeting of FWF CNV I addressed and presented the added value of social dialogue
Q2 (6): Letters sent to Parliament and response of the Minister/Ministry of Social Affairs about the ILO Convention; June 20th, there was a debate in Parliament about ICSR, where FoA and ICSR issues such as living wage were mentioned Q3: (1) Late September, the three SP members sent a joint letter to Minister Kaag to support her to include the ratification and implementation of the new ILO convention C190 on Violence and Harassment as part of the (negotiations on) trade agreements. Q4: Pop up store, Debate in Parliament (about the budget and plans for 2020)

Q3: "-Active role in Social Working Group of AGT. - RVO meeting about SD and FoA. - Cooperate with MODINT in their riskchecker tool for MODINT brands together with a.o UNICEF - participation in Kledingoverleg NGO’s en CNV/FNV - Active role in tripartite meeting (NL govt and social partners) about ILO Convention "

title.narrative: # of dialogues, meetings, consultations, briefings, seminars, workshops, conferences, summits, etc held with policymakers, companies, influential decision-makers on SP issues, claims and policy goals

description.narrative: # of (re)presentations in policy dialogue on SP issues, claims or policy goals

comment.narrative: 1.Several contacts between Dutch unions and Dutch Ministry of Social Affairs with regard to the Dutch response to the ILO questionnaire for the violence at work (VAW) standard, 2.Union statement developed regard to ILO questionnaire on standard for ending violence at work 3. Dutch unions submitted their version of the questionnaire to the ILO, 4.Promote the ITUC draft response to the ILO questionnaire amongst partner trade unions and mobilise them to advocate towards their governments, 5.Interview with CNV Internationaal president Arend van Wijngaarden included in report Plan Nederland about social dialogue & gender in the supply chain. https://www.plannederland.nl/uploaded/GAA-Report-Investing-in-Girls-and-Women-prt-.pdf

Q1 (14): Enhance level of support for the ILO Convention: 1) AD had a meeting with several NGO's to discuss and enhance the level of support for the ILO Convention to end violence and intimidation in the world of work; 2) CNV I had a meeting and direct contact with the political advisor of the Labour Party on the ILO Convention to violence and intimidation in the world of work: 3) CNV I had a meeting with the Ministry of Social Affairs together with FNV to discuss the position of the NL towards the ILO Convention; 4) CNV Chair man spoke about the ILO Convention with the Minister; 5) CNV I had meetings with several ambassador during the ambassador days, incl Vietnam, where we spoke about the ILO Convention and building support of the Convention; 6) CNV took part in the OECD Forum in February, together with our partner CLC from Cambodia, to discuss SD issues in the garment industry; 7) CNV presented our work and SD for MODINT; 8) CNV Internationaal had a meeting with Jos Huber about living wage; 9) CNV I was part of the Dutch UN delegation for the CSW where the ILO Convention on ending violence and intimidation in the world of work was brought up as one of the main topics 10) CNV I presented their main targets and issues in preparation for the CSW where the ILO Convention was one of the main topics; 11) Preparing the mission to Vietnam with MoFA in several 12) meetings and with several stakeholders such as 13) Inretail and 14) IDH
Q2 (11): In April 2019, at a workshop for new signatories of the AGT, and new staff of existing signatories, CNV held a presentation on Freedom of Association an d social dialogue and the services that CNV can provide to brands to support them in promoting SD in their supply chains (1). In June, CNV organized together with FNV and FWF a so-called petition in Parliament, handing over a manifest to call upon Members of Parliament for support of the ILO COnvention to end violence and harassment in the world of work (1); in order to get enough political support, CNV talked (before the petition) with Steven van Weyenberg (D66) about the issue as well with the staff of Gijs van Dijk/Kirsten van den Hul (PvdA) (2, 3). During the petition, 7 MPs were present: CDA (4), VVD (5), GL (6), 50Plus (7), PvdA (8), D66 (9), SP (10). Q3 (5): 1. SD: On July 2nd, during the members day of the Dutch Agreement on Sustainable Garments and Textile, CNV (and FNV and FWF) engaged with member brands of the AGT about their sourcing practices and how these could facilitate social dialogue in their supply chains. 2. SD: In July, CNV met with a CSR manager of a member company of the AGT to discuss previous labour issues at several of its factories in Cambodia and exchange information on the developments in the case, and advise on a way forward for the brand to promote social dialogue and freedom of association at the factories concerned. 3-5 GBV: On September 4th, the three SP partners organised a lunch meeting for parliamentarians about the labour conditions in the textile sector. The parliamentarians present, from GreenLeft, Labour party and D66 exchanged views actively and learned about the specific labour issues in various countries, indicating intentions to promote the interests of textile workers in these countries in future parliamentarian debates. Q4: Meetings with Members of Parliament about International Corporate Social Responsibility in preparation of a political debate in Parliament (PvdA, GL, D66, VVD, CDA) Pop up store event: Minister Kaag was present (1), Members of Parliament (7), Minister Koolmees was informed about the event (1), policy makers of Social Affairs and MoFA were present (4). Meetings with 5 textile companies (C&A, WE, Tricorp, Groenendijk, Yongo) advising on Social Dialogue policies in Cambodia, Indonesia and Vietnam.

Q1: joint in partnership with FWF: 1. Face2Face in Utrecht on Lobby and the 3 themes. Extra: prepared a Meet & Greet follow up session for April 5, on SD and FoA. In Q1 we have been in the proces of making a SD and FoA questionnaire for brands andin discussion with suppliers. Input for internetconsultation new Dutch policy on Development Cooperation and Trade.
Q2. Meet & Greet SD FoA held at SER.
Q3 all brands of Textile Covenant received SD/FoA Questionnaire. Embassies received the SD paper making their role in promoting SD explicit. L&A Webinar among INT NL staff and local representatives and partners.
Q4: 1. Meeting with several stakeholders during the ITUC conference in Copenhagen about GBV 2. Consultation Meeting with the Ministry about brown report 3. Stakeholdermeeting on SD and LW during the annual conference of FWF 4. Workshop during FWF membersday on FoA/SD 5) Field visit with HEMA about textile covenant
